privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: This privacy policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect your personal data in compliance with Swiss data protection laws.

content: [Agency Name] (hereinafter "the Agency", "we", "us", "our") is committed to protecting the privacy and security of the personal data of individuals who contact us through the contact form available on our website. This Privacy Policy aims to transparently inform you about how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal data in this specific context, in accordance with applicable data protection laws.

It is essential to emphasize that this policy applies exclusively to personal data collected via the contact form accessible at [Website Address]. It does not cover personal data collected by other means (e.g., applications sent directly by email, telephone interviews, general Browse data on our website not directly related to form submission, or the processing of candidate data within the scope of specific recruitment mandates, which are subject to separate privacy notices).

Our practices comply with current Swiss legislation, notably the Federal Act on Data Protection (nFADP). Given our location in Geneva and the nature of our activities, which may involve interactions with individuals located in the European Economic Area (EEA), we also strive to respect the principles and requirements of the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) where applicable. This dual approach ensures a high level of protection for your personal data. The clear limitation of this policy's scope to only the contact form ensures precise and targeted information for this specific interaction, avoiding confusion with more complex data processing managed by the Agency, such as that related to application files.

The processing of information via this form (mainly names, contact details, and message content) generally does not constitute a high-risk or large-scale activity justifying such a mandatory designation for a company of our size in this specific context. This in no way affects our commitment to protecting your data. For any questions or to exercise your rights, please use the general contact details mentioned above.
Providing clear and direct contact details is essential to ensure transparency and allow you to easily exercise your data protection rights.

sections.full_title: 3. Personal Data Collected via the Contact Form
sections.short_title: Personal Data Collected via the Contact Form
content: When you use our contact form, we directly collect the following categories of personal data, which you actively provide to us:
Full name (First name and Last name)
Email address
Phone number (if this field is included in the form)
Subject of your message (if this field is included)
The content of your message / your query

It is important to note that if you choose to voluntarily include other personal information in the free text field of your message, this information will also be collected and processed by our services in order to respond to your request.

We kindly ask you not to include sensitive personal data in the contact form unless it is strictly necessary and relevant to your specific request. Sensitive data includes, according to the nFADP and GDPR, information about political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, trade union membership, health, sex life or sexual orientation, as well as genetic or biometric data uniquely identifying you. Submitting such data via this general form is discouraged, as it is not specifically designed for their secure processing and would require enhanced protection and consent measures. By limiting the shared data to what is strictly necessary, you contribute to data minimization and risk reduction.

sections.full_title: 4. Purposes of Processing Your Personal Data
sections.short_title: Purposes of Processing Your Personal Data
content: The personal data we collect via the contact form are used exclusively for the following purposes:
Receiving and Processing Your Request: To register your contact and understand the subject of your query or message.
Communication and Response: To contact you back to answer your question, provide the requested information, or follow up on your query.

Pre-contractual Management: If your request concerns our placement or staffing services (e.g., a company wishing to collaborate with us), to use your data to manage pre-contractual exchanges and ensure necessary follow-up.

Internal Record Keeping: To maintain a record of our communications for internal administrative purposes, to monitor the quality of our services, and to meet potential legal documentation obligations.

We wish to emphasize that data collected through this contact form will not be used for direct marketing or unsolicited commercial prospecting, unless you have given your explicit and separate consent for such communications (e.g., by voluntarily subscribing to our newsletter via a distinct mechanism). This strict adherence to the initial purpose of your contact complies with the fundamental principles of the nFADP and GDPR  and clearly distinguishes this processing from the more in-depth processing of candidate data within the scope of our recruitment mandates.
The processing of your personal data collected via the contact form is based on the following legal grounds, in accordance with Article 31 of the nFADP and Article 6 of the GDPR:

Your Consent (Art. 31 para. 1 nFADP; Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR): By actively filling out and submitting the contact form, you express your free and informed consent to the processing of the personal data you entered, for the specific purposes of receiving and processing your request as described in section 4. This consent is the primary basis for the initial collection of your information via the form.

Our Legitimate Interests (Art. 31 para. 1 nFADP; Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR): We have a legitimate interest in processing your data to respond effectively to your inquiry, ensure smooth and professional communication, and maintain records of our exchanges for proper internal administration. This interest is considered overriding compared to your own interests or fundamental rights and freedoms, given that you initiate the contact and have a reasonable expectation of receiving a response. Processing is limited to what is necessary to achieve these legitimate objectives.

Performance of Pre-contractual Measures (Art. 31 para. 2 let. a nFADP; Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR): If your request via the contact form constitutes a step towards establishing a contractual relationship with our Agency (e.g., a request for information about our recruitment services by a potential corporate client), the processing of your data is necessary for the performance of these pre-contractual measures taken at your request.

The use of these different legal bases, where applicable, ensures a solid and compliant justification for processing your data in the specific context of the contact form, even if the initial consent were withdrawn.

We retain your personal data collected via the contact form only for the duration necessary to fulfill the purposes for which they were collected, and in compliance with the principle of proportionality and legal obligations. The specific retention criteria are as follows:

Simple Requests: If your message concerns a one-off information request or a simple question that can be resolved quickly, your associated personal data will generally be deleted or anonymized within a reasonable period after the exchange is closed and your request is fully resolved.

Business Correspondence and Legal Obligations: If your contact and subsequent exchanges constitute business correspondence (e.g., exchanges with a potential client, pre-contractual discussions), the relevant data may be retained in accordance with Swiss legal obligations regarding the retention of business records. In particular, Article 958f of the Swiss Code of Obligations requires a retention period of ten (10) years for accounting books and records, which may include certain business correspondence.

Lack of Necessity: In all cases, as soon as your personal data are no longer necessary for the purposes described in section 4 and no legal obligation or overriding legitimate interest justifies longer retention, they will be securely deleted or anonymized.
This differentiated approach to retention periods ensures that we do not keep your data longer than necessary, while respecting our legal obligations.

sections.full_title: 7. Communication of Your Data to Third Parties and International Transfers
sections.short_title: Communication of Your Data to Third Parties and International Transfers
content: We treat your personal data with the utmost confidentiality.

Internal Access: Access to your personal data collected via the contact form is strictly limited to authorized members of our staff (e.g., administrative staff, consultants responsible for the area related to your query) whose duties require processing this information to respond to your request. These individuals are subject to confidentiality obligations.

Processors (Service Providers): We may use third-party service providers (processors) to assist us in managing our website and communications (e.g., web hosting provider, email service provider, IT support). These providers may have access to your personal data only to the extent necessary to perform their mandates and act on our instructions. We ensure that they provide sufficient guarantees regarding data protection through contractual agreements compliant with legal requirements.

Other Third Parties: Your personal data will neither be sold, rented, nor otherwise communicated to third parties for marketing purposes or their own commercial objectives. Communication to third parties may only occur if we are legally compelled to do so (e.g., upon request from a judicial or administrative authority) or if you have given us your explicit prior consent.

International Data Transfers: It is possible that personal data collected via this form may be processed or stored by our service providers in countries outside Switzerland or the European Economic Area (EEA), particularly when using common cloud solutions.If a transfer takes place to a country whose legislation ensures a level of data protection deemed adequate by the Swiss Federal Council (according to the list published in Annex 1 of the Data Protection Ordinance - DPO) and/or by the European Commission, no additional guarantees are required. EEA countries, the United Kingdom (under conditions), Canada (for organizations under PIPEDA), among others, are generally considered adequate.

If a transfer takes place to a country without an adequate level of protection (e.g., the United States, depending on the providers and the legal framework in force), we ensure that appropriate safeguards are implemented to protect your data. These safeguards primarily consist of using Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved or recognized by the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) and/or by the European Commission. If necessary, additional technical or organizational measures may be implemented following a transfer impact assessment to ensure a level of protection equivalent to that guaranteed in Switzerland and the EEA.
We are committed to ensuring the protection of your personal data, regardless of where it is processed.

In accordance with the nFADP and GDPR, you have several rights concerning your personal data that we process following your use of the contact form. These rights aim to give you control over your information.
You can exercise the following rights:

Right of access: Obtain confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning you are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data and certain information about their processing.
Right to rectification: Obtain the rectification of inaccurate personal data concerning you without undue delay.

Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'): Obtain the erasure of your personal data in certain circumstances (e.g., if they are no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which they were collected, or if you withdraw consent).
Right to restriction of processing: Obtain restriction of processing of your data in certain specific situations (e.g., if you contest the accuracy of the data).

Right to data portability: Receive the personal data concerning you, which you have provided to us, in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller (primarily applicable to processing based on consent or a contract and carried out by automated means).
Right to object: Object at any time, on grounds relating to your particular situation, to processing of personal data concerning you which is based on our legitimate interest.

Right to withdraw consent: Withdraw your consent at any time for processing based on it. The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
How to exercise your rights:

To exercise any of these rights, please send your written request, accompanied by proof of your identity if necessary, to our dedicated email address or by post to the address indicated in Section 2. We will endeavor to respond to your request within the legal deadlines.
Summary Table of Your Rights:

Right to lodge a complaint:

If you believe that the processing of your personal data constitutes a violation of data protection legislation, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority. In Switzerland, this is the:
Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
Feldeggweg 1
CH - 3003 Bern
Website: https://www.edoeb.admin.ch
If you reside in the EEA, you can also contact the data protection authority in your country of residence.

We attach great importance to the security of your personal data. We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures (TOMs) to protect the data collected via the contact form against accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure of, or access to personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed.[6, 10]
These measures include, but are not limited to:
Using the HTTPS protocol to secure data transmission between your browser and our website.
Storing data on secure servers.
Strict access controls to limit access to your data to authorized internal personnel who need to know.
Confidentiality agreements with our staff and service providers.
Regular reviews of our security practices and updating measures based on evolving threats and technologies.

However, it is important to recognize that no data transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is completely infallible. Although we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. By submitting your information via the contact form, you acknowledge the inherent risks of online communication.
Our website uses cookies and similar technologies. Some cookies may be technically necessary for the proper functioning of the page containing the contact form (e.g., session cookies).
If other types of cookies (e.g., for performance analysis or marketing) are used on the page where the contact form is located, their use is subject to your prior consent.

For detailed information on all the cookies we use on our website, their specific purposes, their lifespan, and how you can manage your preferences and withdraw your consent, please consult our Cookie Policy accessible via the following link: [Insert link to the website's full Cookie Policy].
Separating detailed cookie information into a dedicated policy helps maintain the clarity and conciseness of this Privacy Policy focused on the contact form.

We reserve the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time, in particular to adapt it to legislative, regulatory, jurisprudential, or technological developments, or to reflect changes in our data processing practices.

Any changes will take effect upon their publication on our website. The "Last updated" date indicated at the top of this document will be amended accordingly. In the event of substantial changes likely to affect your rights or how we process your data, we will endeavor to inform you through appropriate means (e.g., via a notification on our website). Nevertheless, we encourage you to consult this page regularly to be aware of the most recent version.
This Privacy Policy, as well as any questions arising from or related to it and the use of the contact form, are governed by substantive Swiss law, excluding its conflict of laws rules.

Any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Privacy Policy shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the ordinary courts of the Canton of Geneva, Switzerland. This clause aims to ensure legal certainty for all parties involved.

sub_sections.title: Purpose of This Privacy Policy
sub_sections.content: This Privacy Policy aims to inform users ("you," "your") of Interimed ("we," "us," "our," "Platform") about how we collect, use, process, share, and protect your personal data when you access and use our website, mobile applications, and services (collectively, the "Services"). This document also outlines your data protection rights under applicable Swiss law, primarily the Swiss Federal Act on Data Protection (nLPD/FADP), and, where applicable, the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The FADP, in its revised form (nLPD), serves as the primary legal framework governing data protection in Switzerland, aiming to protect the confidentiality of personal data and ensure its lawful processing across various stages including collection, storage, use, transfer, and retention. By using the Services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy.

sub_sections.title: Our Commitment to Data Protection
sub_sections.content: Platform Name] is committed to upholding the highest standards of data protection and privacy. This commitment is in compliance with the Swiss nLPD/FADP and, where relevant, international standards such as the GDPR. Our data handling practices are guided by core data protection principles:
principles: Lawfulness, Fairness, and Transparency: We process personal data lawfully, fairly, and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject.
Purpose Limitation: Personal data is collected for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes.
Data Minimization: We ensure that personal data collected is adequate, relevant, and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which it is processed.
Accuracy: We take reasonable steps to ensure that personal data is accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date.
Storage Limitation: Personal data is kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data is processed.

Integrity and Confidentiality: We process personal data in a manner that ensures appropriate security, including protection against unauthorized or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction, or damage, using appropriate technical or organizational measures.
sub_sections.conclusion: Adherence to these principles is fundamental, particularly for a platform entrusted with sensitive professional and contractual information, as it builds a foundation of trust with our users.

sub_sections.title: Applicability of GDPR
sub_sections.content: While the Platform operates under Swiss law (nLPD/FADP), the GDPR may apply to the processing of personal data of individuals located in the European Union (EU) or the European Economic Area (EEA) if our Services are offered to them, or if their behavior is monitored by us. Switzerland is not an EU member, so GDPR compliance is not inherently required for all Swiss entities; however, its provisions become relevant when engaging with EU/EEA data subjects. This policy addresses GDPR requirements to the extent they apply to our data processing activities. This dual consideration of nLPD and GDPR reflects a commitment to robust data protection standards and facilitates smoother interactions for any users who may be in the EU/EEA, signaling preparedness for international operations.

sub_sections.dpo_strategic_note: The decision to appoint a DPO, even if voluntary for most private Swiss companies, carries strategic weight. Appointing a DPO and notifying the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) can, for instance, exempt the company from mandatory FDPIC consultation for Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) in certain high-risk processing scenarios. Given that the Platform handles potentially sensitive data such as CVs, contracts, and fiduciary agreements, this consideration is pertinent. This policy reflects our current approach to this aspect of data governance.

sub_sections.content: This Privacy Policy applies to all personal data processed by Interimed through our website, mobile applications, and all related Services. This includes, but is not limited to, personal data processed in connection with:

Contract management functionalities, including the use of e-signature services.
